pr_title: Java based formatter2 API and Xtext formatter

timeline.author: cdietrich
cdietrich
cdietrich

replies.bodyText: Personally I wouldn't consider this to be API.
replies.author: szarnekow

replies.bodyText: Unlikely that someone wants to override this method ... so probably ok ... I could also restore the new name, but it is then misleading. Would stay with the change.
replies.author: ArneDeutsch

replies.bodyText: Yes. Not sure why github display it this way, but I removed the x-friends clause only. This marks the API as final and removes the warnings for formatters impolemented the new API. Have just double checked that I really removed the x-friends clause only.
replies.author: ArneDeutsch

timeline.bodyText: I know it's a test, but for documentation purpose it would be good to find a better name for it
timeline.author: szarnekow

replies.bodyText: it -> it. is clutter that I can not get rid of. noSpace() only, as in Xtend, is much more nice. I can not make a nice name of it, just want to keep it short. This is why I stick to the "default" ... other than that I would choose a one-letter-name ...
replies.author: ArneDeutsch

replies.bodyText:
f -> f is also nonsaying
IHiddenRegionFormatter::noSpace
is also lengthy
replies.author: cdietrich

timeline.bodyText: Can this become a reusable utility if we inject the interface of the formatter instead of the concrete type?
timeline.author: szarnekow
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@

+ *******************************************************************************/
+package org.eclipse.xtext.formatting2.internal;
+
+import org.eclipse.xtext.formatting2.IFormatter2;
+import org.eclipse.xtext.testing.formatter.FormatterTestHelper;
+import org.eclipse.xtext.testing.formatter.FormatterTestRequest;
+
+import com.google.inject.Inject;
+
+/**
+ * @author Arne Deutsch - Initial contribution and API
+ */
+public class JavaFormatterTestHelper extends FormatterTestHelper {
+
+	@Inject
+	private FormatterTestLanguageJavaFormatter formatter;

replies.author: ArneDeutsch

timeline.bodyText: As far as I can tell, AbstractXtextTests was meant to be used for various test languages in this test bundle. Having a method load(URI) that expects the resource to point to an Xtext grammar file, appears to be wrong.
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: Can this go to some of the various Serialization test utils?
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: This file is very hard to review because of the changed indentation of the test expectation. Can you please restore the original indentation?
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: Hmm I would have expected something like // TODO: implement for Person, Description at the bottom according to the fragment implementation. But maybe we can just remove that TODO from the fragment.
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: The output of the if clause is not part of the test expectation.
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: please use a more descriptive name for it or replace by method reference TypeOfIt::noSpace
timeline.author: szarnekow
szarnekow

timeline.bodyText: Is regionFor(rule) a cheap call? Or should we store the region in a local var?
timeline.author: szarnekow

timeline.message:
[eclipse/xtext#1697] Abstract super class for java based formatters.
[#1489] Java based Xtext formatter (formatter2 API).

Remove API restrictions.
Testing java based formatter.
Formatter2 Java Fragment.
